duties_responsibilities.duty: Partner with employees and management to communicate various human resource policies, procedures, laws, standards, and other government regulations.
Attract, recruit and close salary and hourly candidates to join the Grammer team.
Provide analytical and project management support.
Act as an employee relations specialist assisting in investigation and resolution of employee issues.
Provide communication of programs and drive resolution of issues related to employee concerns regarding payroll, benefits, and other employee programs.
Maintain employee data in various systems and tools.
Actively participate in plant teams/committees and assume a leadership role in HR related issues.
Promote and reinforce the Grammer WoW (Way of Working) culture.
Drive the plant engagement of the CODE behaviors at all levels.
Perform monthly data reporting for the facility.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree (Master’s preferred) in Human Resources, Labor Relations, or Business Administration.
